english_translation: Narrated by Anas ibn Malik: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'Allah the Mighty and Majestic said: O son of Adam, remember Me in yourself and I will remember you in Myself. And if you remember Me in a gathering, I will remember you in a gathering better than it. And if you draw near to Me by a hand's span, I will draw near to you by an arm's length. And if you draw near to Me by an arm's length, I will draw near to you by a fathom's length. And if you come to Me walking, I will come to you running.' And Ma'mar said: Qatadah said: 'And Allah is quicker with forgiveness.'

english_translation: Narrated by Umm Ikrimah bint Khalid: She sent her brother to Abu Hurairah asking him about a man saying 'There is no god except Allah, alone without partner, to Him belongs the sovereignty and to Him is the praise, and He is able to do all things.' Abu Hurairah said: 'If a man says it ten times, he is equivalent to freeing a slave.' Abu Hurairah also said: 'So increase from freeing of slaves.'

english_translation: Narrated by Abu Hurairah: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'When a people gather remembering Allah, mercy envelops them, tranquility descends upon them, and Allah mentions them among those with Him.' And he also said: 'Verily, Allah grants respite until the first third of the night has passed, then He descends to the lowest heaven and calls: Is there a sinner who repents? Is there a seeker of forgiveness? Is there a supplicant? Is there a questioner? Until the dawn comes.'

english_translation: It is narrated from al-Hasan: 'On the Day of Judgment, an announcer will call: 'Today the gathering will know who has the most honor. Where are those whose sides shrank from the beds in the night and spent from what We provided for them? They will rise and step over the necks of people. Then another call: Where are those for whom trade and commerce did not distract them from the remembrance of Allah? They will rise and step over the necks of people. Then a third call: Where are those who praised Allah in all circumstances? They will rise and they are many. Then the reckoning and consequences will be for those remaining.'

english_translation: Narrated by Abdullah ibn Amr ibn al-As: 'When a man says: There is no god except Allah, alone without partner, to Him belongs the sovereignty and to Him is the praise - this is the word of sincerity which Allah did not accept any deed from anyone until he says it. When he says: All praise is for Allah - this is the word that Allah did not forgive any servant until he says it. When he says: Allah is the Greatest - this fills what is between the heavens and the earth. When he says: Glorified is Allah - this is the prayer of all creatures. When he says: There is no power and no might except by Allah - he said: he submitted and surrendered.'
